elements.title: Afar fossil shows broad distribution and versatility of Paranthropus
elements.contents:
Afar fossil shows broad distribution and versatility of Paranthropus

With its attribution to Paranthropus, a 2.6-million-year-old partial mandible expands the range of the genus into the Afar region of Ethiopia and adds to our understanding of hominin evolution in eastern Africa.

  • Zeresenay Alemseged
  • Fred Spoor
  • Jonathan G. Wynn
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Construction of complex and diverse DNA sequences using DNA three-way junctions
elements.contents:
Construction of complex and diverse DNA sequences using DNA three-way junctions

Sidewinder enables high-fidelity DNA assembly by separating the information that guides assembly from the final assembled sequence.

  • Noah Evan Robinson
  • Weilin Zhang
  • Kaihang Wang
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Extreme barocaloric effect at dissolution
elements.contents:
Extreme barocaloric effect at dissolution

An extreme barocaloric effect in NH4SCN aqueous solutions is enabled by pressure-induced dissolution and precipitation, but without using a separate heat-transfer liquid.

  • Kun Zhang
  • Yifang Liu
  • Bing Li
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Temporal tissue dynamics from a spatial snapshot
elements.contents:
Temporal tissue dynamics from a spatial snapshot

One-shot tissue dynamics reconstruction can infer changes in tissue composition over time, from single-time-point spatial proteomics of human cancers.

  • Jonathan Somer
  • Shie Mannor
  • Uri Alon
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Pyramidal neurons proportionately alter cortical interneuron subtypes
elements.contents:
Pyramidal neurons proportionately alter cortical interneuron subtypes

Pyramidal neuron-driven mechanisms actively promote the survival and terminal differentiation of their associated interneuron subtypes.

  • Sherry Jingjing Wu
  • Min Dai
  • Gord Fishell
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Rock art from at least 67,800 years ago in Sulawesi
elements.contents:
Rock art from at least 67,800 years ago in Sulawesi

A hand stencil painted on a cave wall on a small island off the coast of Sulawesi more than 67,800 years ago suggests a very early occupation of Wallacea.

  • Adhi Agus Oktaviana
  • Renaud Joannes-Boyau
  • Maxime Aubert
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Core–envelope miscibility in sub-Neptunes and super-Earths
elements.contents:
Core–envelope miscibility in sub-Neptunes and super-Earths

First-principles molecular dynamics driven by density functional theory is used to show that silicate and hydrogen are completely miscible over a wide range of plausible core–envelope pressure–temperature conditions.

  • Travis Gilmore
  • Lars Stixrude
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Four camera-type eyes in the earliest vertebrates from the Cambrian Period
elements.contents:
Four camera-type eyes in the earliest vertebrates from the Cambrian Period

Early vertebrates, particularly myllokunmingids, possessed four camera-type eyes (a pair of lateral eyes and pineal and parapineal organs), which indicates that these structures functioned in image formation, in support of the hypothesis that the four camera-type eyes represent an ancestral vertebrate trait.

  • Xiangtong Lei
  • Sihang Zhang
  • Xing Xu
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Identification of an allosteric site on the E3 ligase adapter cereblon
elements.contents:
Identification of an allosteric site on the E3 ligase adapter cereblon

An allosteric site on the E3 ligase adapter cereblon can be targeted to modulate the efficacy of cereblon in targeted protein degradation applications.

  • Vanessa N. Dippon
  • Zeba Rizvi
  • Christina M. Woo
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Predatory aggression evolved through adaptations to noradrenergic circuits
elements.contents:
Predatory aggression evolved through adaptations to noradrenergic circuits

Noradrenergic circuits support and balance aggressive behavioural states in predatory nematodes, distinguish predatory from non-predatory nematode species and are associated with the evolution of complex behavioural traits.

  • Güniz Göze Eren
  • Leonard Böger
  • James W. Lightfoot
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: The potential for bridgmanite megacrysts to drive magma ocean segregation
elements.contents:
The potential for bridgmanite megacrysts to drive magma ocean segregation

Large-scale molecular dynamics simulations show that the crystal–melt interfacial energies of MgSiO3 bridgmanite increase substantially with pressure, potentially forming unusually large bridgmanite crystals and suggesting a new physical mechanism driving magma ocean segregation.

  • Jie Deng
  • Junwei Hu
  • Lars Stixrude
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Ageing promotes microglial accumulation of slow-degrading synaptic proteins
elements.contents:
Ageing promotes microglial accumulation of slow-degrading synaptic proteins

Newly developed mouse models that enable cell-specific analyses of proteostasis dynamics across the lifespan of the mice reveal key aspects of neuronal proteostasis with ageing.

  • Ian H. Guldner
  • Viktoria P. Wagner
  • Tony Wyss-Coray
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Oxygen-free metabolism in the bird inner retina supported by the pecten
elements.contents:
Oxygen-free metabolism in the bird inner retina supported by the pecten

While the photoreceptor outer segments in the bird outer retina have access to oxygen, the inner retina operates under chronic anoxia, supported by anaerobic glycolysis in the retinal neurons.

  • Christian Damsgaard
  • Mia Viuf Skøtt
  • Jens Randel Nyengaard
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Critical role for a high-plasticity cell state in lung cancer
elements.contents:
Critical role for a high-plasticity cell state in lung cancer

The high-plasticity cell state (HPCS) is a critical hub that enables reciprocal transitions between cancer cell states, and targeting the HPCS may suppress cancer progression and eradicate treatment resistance.

  • Jason E. Chan
  • Chun-Hao Pan
  • Tuomas Tammela
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Large-scale dynamos driven by shear-flow-induced jets
elements.contents:
Large-scale dynamos driven by shear-flow-induced jets

Aadvanced computer simulations of three-dimensional turbulence reveal that the ab initio generation of large-scale magnetic fields is driven by shear-flow-induced jets; an analytical model is derived which reproduces the essential features of the flow- and field-generation mechanisms.

  • B. Tripathi
  • A. E. Fraser
  • R. Fan
Article21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Common variation in meiosis genes shapes human recombination and aneuploidy
elements.contents:
Common variation in meiosis genes shapes human recombination and aneuploidy

Analysis of data from pre-implantation genetic testing sheds light on the genetic basis of meiotic-origin aneuploidy, the leading cause of human pregnancy loss, identifying common genetic variants associated with maternal meiotic errors.

  • Sara A. Carioscia
  • Arjun Biddanda
  • Rajiv C. McCoy
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Dissecting gene regulatory networks governing human cortical cell fate
elements.contents:
Dissecting gene regulatory networks governing human cortical cell fate

Systematic screening of transcription factors reveals conserved mechanisms governing cortical radial glia lineage progression across primates and provides a framework for functional dissection of gene regulatory networks in human cortical neurogenesis.

  • Jingwen W. Ding
  • Chang N. Kim
  • Alex A. Pollen
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Quantum spin resonance in engineered proteins for multimodal sensing
elements.contents:
Quantum spin resonance in engineered proteins for multimodal sensing

A recently developed class of magneto-sensitive fluorescent proteins are engineered to alter the properties of their response to magnetic fields and radio frequencies, enabling multimodal sensing of biological systems.

  • Gabriel Abrahams
  • Ana Štuhec
  • Harrison Steel
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: LetA defines a structurally distinct transporter family
elements.contents:
LetA defines a structurally distinct transporter family

The distinct architecture of the Escherichia coli membrane transporter LetA mediates lipid trafficking across the bacterial envelope in partnership with the tunnel-like complex LetB.

  • Cristina C. Santarossa
  • Yupeng Li
  • Gira Bhabha
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026

elements.title: Probing quantum mechanics with nanoparticle matter-wave interferometry
elements.contents:
Probing quantum mechanics with nanoparticle matter-wave interferometry

Quantum interference of sodium nanoparticles, which can each contain more than 7,000 atoms at masses greater than 170,000 Da, is demonstrated.

  • Sebastian Pedalino
  • Bruno E. Ramírez-Galindo
  • Stefan Gerlich
ArticleOpen Access21 Jan 2026
